homeworlds.CMD_ATK_OWNER: In games with more than two players, you have to always specify the owner of the ship you are attacking.
homeworlds.CMD_ATK_SIZE: You don't have a ship large enough to attack the ship {{target}}.
homeworlds.CMD_BUILD_TEMPLATE: You do not have a model from which to build a new ship.
homeworlds.CMD_CATA_ACTIONS: You may not trigger a catastrophe while you still have actions to use.
homeworlds.CMD_CATA_INVALID: There is no overpopulation of {{colour}} in the {{system}} system.
homeworlds.CMD_DISC_DOUBLE: A system by the name {{name}} has already been charted.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_COLOURS: You're requesting a home world with fewer than three technologies available. This is almost never wise. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_DOUBLE: You already have a home world.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_RHO: You're requesting a home world with the same star sizes as your right-hand opponent. This puts your nemesis only one jump away from you! If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_SAMESIZE: You're requesting a home world with two stars of the same size. This puts you at a strong disadvantage. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_SINGLE: You're requesting a home world with only one star. This puts you at a strong disadvantage. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_SMALLSHIP: You are requesting a home world without a large ship. This puts you at a disadvantage. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_TECHS: You're requesting a home world that does not contain Green or Blue technologies. This is almost never wise. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_MOVE_CONNECTION: The systems {{from}} and {{to}} are not connected. You can only travel between systems that do not share any of the same-sized stars.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_B: You have no more trade actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_G: You have no construction actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_R: You do not have any attack actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_Y: You have no movement actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOSYSTEM: Could not find a system with the name {{system}}.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_B: You do not have access to refurbishers (BLUE) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_G: You do not have access to shipyards (GREEN) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_R: You do not have access to weapons technology (RED) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_Y: You do not have access to propulsion technology (YELLOW) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_PARAMETERS: The wrong number of parameters were provided.
homeworlds.CMD_PASS_FREE: You may not pass your free action.
homeworlds.CMD_PASS_TOOMANY: You tried to pass more actions than you have remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_STARSHIP_NAME: The following ship/star designation could not be understood: {{arg}}.
homeworlds.CMD_TRADE_DOUBLE: You can't trade a ship for one of the same colour.
homeworlds.MOVE_MOREACTIONS: You still have actions to spend.
homeworlds.STASH_EMPTY: The stash has no more {{colour}} pieces left.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_BADNAME: The system name you requested ({{name}}) is invalid. Names may be no longer than 25 characters, must start with a letter or a number, and may only contain numbers, letters, hyphens, and underscores. No spaces are allowed.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_FULL: The {{system}} system is full. Home systems can only accommodate 16 ships. Periphery systems can accommodate 24.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_NOSHIP: Could not find the ship {{ship} in the {{system}} system.

INITIAL_UNDO: You can't undo the initial starting position of the game.
MOVES_GAMEOVER: You cannot make moves in concluded games
MOVES_INVALID: The move '{{move}}' is invalid. Please check the rules and try again.
MOVES_SIMULTANEOUS_PARTIAL: In simultaneous games, both players' moves must be submitted at the same time.

_general.CAPTURE4MOVE: You signalled a capture, but there's no piece at {{where}}.
_general.DEFAULT_HANDLER: This is the default handler and should never be called directly. Please inform the administrator.
_general.FAILSAFE: The move '{{move}}' passed validation but does not appear to be legal. Please inform the administrator.
_general.INVALIDCELL: Could not find the cell {{cell}} on the board.
_general.MOVE4CAPTURE: You signalled a regular move, but {{where}} is occupied.
_general.NOLOS: There is no line of sight between {{from}} and {{to}}.
_general.NONEXISTENT: Trying to interact with a piece or stack that doesn't exist at {{where}}.
_general.NOPIECES: You have no pieces to place.
_general.OBSTRUCTED: There is an obstruction at {{obstruction}} between {{from}} and {{to}}.
_general.SAME_FROM_TO: The 'from' and 'to' cells have to be different.
_general.SELFCAPTURE: You cannot capture your own pieces.
_general.UNCONTROLLED: You cannot move pieces you don't control.

abande.DISCONNECTEDMOVE: A move from {{from}} to {{to}} would disconnect the band.
abande.DISCONNECTEDPLACE: Placing a piece at {{where}} would disconnect the band.
abande.INVALIDPASS: You cannot pass while you have pieces in hand.
abande.MOVE2CONTROLLED: You cannot capture your own stacks.
abande.MOVE2EMPTY: You cannot move to empty spaces.
abande.PARTIAL: It's possible you're trying to move a stack. Provide the destination.
abande.TOOEARLY: You cannot move until the first player has placed two pieces.
abande.TOOHIGH: Moving from {{from}} to {{to}} would result in a stack taller than three pieces high.

accasta.INVALID_SIZE: In the move '{{move}}', the step '{{step}}' contains an invalid number of pieces to move. Remember that if you're removing the entire stack, omit the number altogether.
accasta.PARTIAL_FULLSTACK: Looks like you want to move an entire stack. Provide the destination.
accasta.PARTIAL_SUBSTACK_one: Looks like you want to move the top piece from the stack. Provide the destination.
accasta.PARTIAL_SUBSTACK_other: Looks like you want to move the top {{count}} pieces from the stack. Provide the destination.
accasta.SOURCE_EMPTY: In the move '{{move}}', when you come to the step '{{step}}', you don't have any pieces left to move.
accasta.TOOFAR: In the move '{{move}}', the step '{{step}}' tries to move further than it is allowed.
accasta.TOOHIGH: In the move '{{move}}', the step '{{step}}' would create a stack greater than six pieces high.
accasta.MORE_THAN_THREE: In the move '{{move}}', the step '{{step}}' would create a stack with more than 3 pieces of the same color.

amazons.POTENTIAL_BLOCK: So far so good. Provide the space you want to block.
amazons.POTENTIAL_MOVE: So far so good. Provide the space you want to move to.
amazons.STRAIGHTLINE: You can only move and block in straight lines.

attangle.EMPTYCAPTURE: One of the cells involved with the capture doesn't have any pieces in it.
attangle.ONVOID: You cannot place pieces on voids (the spaces marked with a black dot).
attangle.POTENTIAL_ONE: This could potentially be a capture. Provide the location of the second stack.
attangle.POTENTIAL_TWO: This could potentially be a capture. Provide the target location.
attangle.TOOHIGH: The combined stack after the capture will be too high.
attangle.TRIPLESTACK: Triple stacks cannot participate in captures.

blam.BADSYNTAX: Invalid syntax: {{move}}. It should a the number 1, 2, or 3 followed by an empty cell (e.g., 1e4, or 3b2).
blam.MOVES_NOPASS: You cannot pass while you have pieces to place.
blam.NOPIECE: You do not have a piece of size {{size}} to place.

breakthrough.BADVARIANT: Bombardment moves are only allowed when that variant is active.
breakthrough.DIAGONAL_CAPTURES: Captures may only be made in a forward-diagonal direction.
breakthrough.NOCAPTURES: Captures are not allowed in the 'Bombardment' variant.
breakthrough.TOOFAR: Pieces can only move one space at a time.

cannon.BAD_RETREAT: Pieces can only retreat if they are adjacent to at least one enemy piece.
cannon.FORWARD_ONLY: Pieces can only move forward, unless capturing laterally or retreating.
cannon.HOMECELL: You can only place your town on your home row, and not on the corners.
cannon.LATERAL_MOVEMENT: Pieces can only move laterally when capturing.
cannon.NOCANNON_CAPTURE: This piece is not in range of any of your cannons.
cannon.NOCANNON_MOVE: There is no cannon along which to move that piece that way.
cannon.RETREAT_DISTANCE: You must retreat two full spaces.
cannon.TOOFAR: You can only move one space at a time, unless retreating.
cannon.UNCONTROLLED: You can't control enemy pieces. If you're trying to capture it by cannon, click it again.

ceph.DUPLICATECAP: You can't capture the same piece more than once.
ceph.NOTADJACENT: You can only capture pieces orthogonally adjacent to your placed piece.
ceph.PARTIAL_ONECAP: Select at least one more adjacent piece to capture.
ceph.TOOHIGH: The pieces you capture cannot total more than six.

volcano.MOVES_AFTER_ERUPTION: You may not continue moving after causing an eruption.
volcano.MOVES_DOUBLE_CAP: Nothing may be placed on top of a cap.
volcano.MOVES_MUST_ERUPT: You must continue moving until you cause an eruption.
volcano.MOVES_NOPIECE: You don't have a {{piece}} piece in your stash to place.
volcano.MOVES_ONE_POWERPLAY: You may only make one power play per turn.
volcano.MOVES_ONE_SPACE: Caps may only be moved one space at a time.
volcano.MOVES_TOO_FAR: Caps may only be moved one space at a time.
